title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6203.7 - Special Investigators and Peace Officer Status Reporting
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6203.7 - Special Investigators and Peace Officer Status Reporting

State Regulations
(a) A request to the commissioners to appoint a special investigator shall set
forth in detail the reason such appointment is needed. (b) At no time shall any firearm be possessed
in the offices of the State Board of Elections other than the space designated
for the Division of Election Law Enforcement. (c) For each person designated by the board
as a special investigator having peace officer status, the chief enforcement
counsel s hall provide notice to the commissioners and co-executive directors
in January and June of each year as to the status of each peace officer's
certifications and training compliance required by section
2.30
of
the criminal procedure law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6203.7

Adopted

New

York State Register September 19, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 38, eff. 9/19/2018

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
